item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Like so many Americans, she was trying to construct a life that made sense from things she found in gift shops." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as I’ve said before, bugs in amber." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "If you can do a half-assed job of anything, you're a one-eyed man in a kingdom of the blind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "All of the true things I am about to tell you are shameless lies." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are healthy only to the extent that our ideas are humane." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "My soul knows my meat is doing bad things, and is embarrassed. But my meat just keeps right on doing bad, dumb things." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And so it goes..." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Life happens too fast for you ever to think about it. If you could just persuade people of this, but they insist on amassing information." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "in nonsense is strength" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Until you die .. it's all life." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And Lot's wife, of course, was told not to look back where all those people and their homes had been. But she did look back, and I love her for that, because it was so human. So she was turned into a pillar of salt. So it goes." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "When two people meet, each one is changed by the other so you've got two new people." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Road to hell paved in unbought stuffed dogs. Not my fault." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Anything that just costs money is cheap." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "All of us take pride and pleasure in the fact that we are unique, but I'm afraid that when all is said and done the police are right: it all comes down to fingerprints." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you read someone else's diary, you get what you deserve." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "How many slams in an old screen door? Depends how loud you shut it. How many slices in a bread? Depends how thin you cut it. How much good inside a day? Depends how good you live 'em. How much love inside a friend? Depends how much you give 'em." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I've been making a list of the things they don't teach you at school. They don't teach you how to love somebody. They don't teach you how to be famous. They don't teach you how to be rich or how to be poor. They don't teach you how to walk away from someone you don't love any longer. They don't teach you how to know what's going on in someone else's mind. They don't teach you what to say to someone who's dying. They don't teach you anything worth knowing." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Each person who ever was or is or will be has a song. It isn't a song that anybody else wrote. It has its own melody, it has its own words. Very few people get to sing their song. Most of us fear that we cannot do it justice with our voices, or that our words are too foolish or too honest, or too odd. So people live their song instead." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but ... life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Don't Panic." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sisterc add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all." -- Douglas Adams
